children.value: It is possible to create inbound integrations using the
If you are creating any kind of non-generic integration, you will need to specify a value for the
property of the integration. Note, you can only set the vendor when creating the integration.
The list of available integrations can be obtained through the
. Each of the resource objects returned by this endpoint have an
property that will be necessary in order to construct the
The next step, once the appropriate vendor's ID is found, is to set the
property of the integration object that you wish to create as a
to the vendor. Note, this can also be done by simply taking the vendor resource object and setting the
property of the integration equal to it.
The integration itself will still need a
property. If setting a vendor, one does not need to set it to anything in particular for each different vendor. Rather:
If creating an integration that is Events API based:
. You can tell that an integration uses the Events API if:
to set up the integration (an authorization process that takes you between the vendor's product and PagerDuty and back again during the set up process)
It involves an integration URL, and/or an integration key (a 32-digit hexadecimal number)
If creating an integration that is email-based:
. If setting up the integration involves an email address, it is email-based.
Once the integration is created, its type will automatically update to the appropriate value.
Putting it all together: for example, if creating an AWS CloudWatch integration:

{
  "type": "info",
  "title": "If creating an email-based integration",
  "body": "You have the option of specifying an integration address by setting the
property of the integration when creating it. If you do not specify one, an email address for the integration will be randomly generated using a

, similar to how integration keys are created."
}
Once created, the body of the response will contain the integration key or integration email, which can be used to trigger, acknowledge and resolve alerts and incidents in PagerDuty.
If the integration is API-based, the
object in the response will contain the key. If it is email-based, it will have a property
containing the email address of the integration.
